content: grocery getter this is a quick and fun project it has a lot of stretch to it but can easily be modified if you d like a larger bag finished dimensions as written and with bag laying flat are width 15 height 15 not including strap the bottom is worked flat so bag has room to expand and stand when filled there is an optional cinch belt used this can easily be left off but comes in handy to hold bag closed when being transported supplies malabrigo organic cotton 2 skeins crochet hook size i tapestry needle 2 stitch markers chain chain single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet sl slip_stitch bottom chain 26 loosely work 2 single_crochet in first chain single_crochet in next 23 stitches 2sc in next chain do not turn but work into the back of the chains already stitched 2sc in first chain single_crochet in next 23 stitches 2 single_crochet in next chain begin working in the round *join w/ slip_stitch to first single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet in same stitch 2 single_crochet in next stitch single_crochet to last two stitches on side 2 single_crochet in each of these stitches 2 single_crochet in first 2 stitches on opposite side single_crochet to last 2 stitches 2 single_crochet in last 2 stitches * repeat 1 more time *join w/sl to first single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet in each straight side alternating 2sc single_crochet 2sc around corners* repeat 2 more times body join w/sl to first single_crochet ch1 single_crochet around 5 times join w/sl to first single_crochet ch1 single_crochet around working 3 sctogs evenly spaced around each corner join w/sl to first single_crochet ch1 single_crochet around 3 times join w/sl to first single_crochet chain 2 half_double_crochet around 3 times *join w/sl to first stitch ch1 single_crochet around join w/sl to first single_crochet ch3 double_crochet around* repeat these 2 row 10 times or to desired size join w/sl to first stitch ch1 single_crochet around 3 times straps join w/sl to first single_crochet ch1 rs single_crochet in next 5 stitches turn *ch1 single_crochet next 5 stitches turn* repeat until strap reaches 14 inches or desired length ending on a rs row lay bag flat and mark stitch on top row of bag that will place the inside of the strap equidistant to the beginning of strap with right sides of strap and bag together single_crochet strap end to bag working into marked stitch on bag being careful not to twist strap mark opposite side of bag for placement of strap making sure that they line up correctly single_crochet to marker for begining of strap rs single_crochet in next 5 stitches turn *ch1 single_crochet next 5 stitches turn* repeat until strap reaches 14 inches or deisred length ending on a rs row with right sides of strap and bag together single_crochet strap end to bag working into marked stitch on bag being careful not to twist strap single_crochet to beginning of row join w/ sl to first single_crochet finish off and weave in ends cinch
